title: Latent Distribution Decoupling: A Probabilistic Framework for Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition
author: Jingwang Huang (College of Computer Science, Chongqing University), Jiang Zhong (College of Computer Science, Chongqing University), Qin Lei (College of Computer Science, Chongqing University), Jingpeng Gao (College of Computer Science, Chongqing University), Yuming Yang (College of Computer Science, Chongqing University), Sirui Wang (Department of Automation, Tsinghua University), Peiguang Li (Meituan Inc.), Kaiwen Wei (College of Computer Science, Chongqing University)
relevance_why: The framework proposed addresses uncertainty in multimodal emotion recognition, which can be insightful for enhancing audio-based emotional analysis where ambient noise and modal variability play critical roles.
background: The study aims to recognize multiple emotions concurrently from different modalities such as text, audio, and video by effectively handling inherent uncertainties in emotional cues.
contribution: This paper introduces Latent emotional Distribution Decoupling with Uncertainty perception (LDDU) to solve the uncertainty modeling challenge in multimodal emotion recognition, achieving state-of-the-art results on benchmark datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on semantic feature extraction and fusion without adequately addressing aleatoric uncertainty and its impact on feature ambiguity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances prior approaches by incorporating a probabilistic framework for modeling uncertainty explicitly via Gaussian distributions in a latent emotional space.

key_innovation: The LDDU framework uniquely integrates semantic feature extraction with uncertainty calibration and contrastive learning for improved emotion representation.
real_world_impact: This framework can enhance emotion recognition systems in applications like human-computer interaction and dialogue systems, leading to better user experience and more nuanced interactions.
limitations: The model does not explicitly utilize the intensity labels of emotions in the datasets, which may affect its ability to distinguish emotions with varying intensities.

new_terms.aleatoric uncertainty: **Aleatoric uncertainty** refers to the uncertainty inherent in the data itself, often due to noise or variability in measurements.
new_terms.Gaussian distributions: **Gaussian distributions** are a type of continuous probability distribution characterized by their symmetric bell-shaped curve, defined by their mean and variance.
